oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Handwritten note of Ann B. Hynds
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: After her husband's death (Judge Robert Hynds) Ann B. Hynds, traded the bulk of the family's fortune in gold for Confederate dollars: "So he got the gold instead of me & gave me his confederate money at par. A. B. Hyndes." After the war, the once prominent family of lawyers, businessmen, and one doctor struggled to survive.
